result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonah R. Vaughn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving Stolen Property (>$2500-$5000) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(bf).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Imposed and stayed

records.addlTxt:
1:31 p.m. Defendant Jonah R. Vaughn in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Defendant Jonah R. Vaughn in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf306 and 15cf171 (revocation). In 15cf306 - Schiek statement on resolution. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Schiek/Richards/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing. Victim Impact statement and restitution statement filed. Victim present in Court.
Court Sentence
Prison - 3-1/2 years - Imposed and Stayed - Initial Confinement - 1-1/2 year; Extended Supervision - 2 years
POP- 3 years
Jail credit - 130 days
Restitution - $1,100 (includes 10%)--actual value of items to be filed within 30 days 
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO. 
Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given. NADVI given.

In 15cf171 - Schiek/Richards/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing
Court Sentence
Jail - 9 months 
Jail Credit - 51 days
Any unpaid financial obligations are reduced to civil judgment
Adj. 2:01 p.m.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter

Defendant Jonah R. Vaughn in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Defendant Jonah R. Vaughn in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
11:21 - Also calling 15cf171- set for revocation at 11:30
  Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over.  - request revocation be adjourned to resolve both cases in one hearing - 
Bail continued
  Arraignment scheduled for May 10, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 10, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

1:57 p.m. Defendant Jonah R. Vaughn in court via video with attorney Steven G. Richards appearing telephonically with leave of court.  Defendant Jonah R. Vaughn in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived
Bail continued. Adj. 1:59 p.m.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 29, 2016 at 11:15 am.

Defendant Jonah R. Vaughn in court, in custody via video.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Clerk to contact Attorney Richards - may appear by telephone if necessary. Bail continued  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

1:47 p.m. Defendant Jonah R. Vaughn in court, in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will seek counsel, Bednar statement to bail - Court sets $7500 cash bond. Adj. 1:49 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
per Nicole at ONSO - Jonah in custody in ONSO
per Brandi @ ONSO - detainer in North Carolina
